meanings.sent1: The ticktack of the hammer hitting the nail echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard the ticktack of raindrops on the window pane.
meanings.sent3: The ticktack of the spoon against the bowl made a rhythmic beat.
meanings.sent4: The ticktack of the typewriter keys filled the quiet office.
meanings.sent5: The ticktack of the metal wind chimes created a soothing melody.

meanings.definition: A method of marking time by the sound of a ticking clock
meanings.sent1: The ticktack of the clock reminded me that it was time for dinner.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the familiar ticktack of the alarm clock.
meanings.sent3: The ticktack of the grandfather clock seemed to slow down as I waited for the guests.
meanings.sent4: The ticktack of the wall clock counted the seconds as I studied for the exam.
meanings.sent5: The ticktack of the pendulum soothed me to sleep every night.

meanings.definition: A game similar to tic-tac-toe, played on a board with nine numbered squares
meanings.sent1: Let's play ticktack after school, it's a fun game!
meanings.sent2: I won the ticktack match by getting three in a row.
meanings.sent3: During recess, the kids enjoyed a quick game of ticktack.
meanings.sent4: The ticktack board was set up for a fierce competition between friends.
meanings.sent5: The ticktack game pieces were carefully placed on the board.
